name: William Taylor REIL, Petitioner v. Judge Cyrus Palmer DOLBIN, DA Christine A. Holman, First ADA Maria T. Casey, ADA Jonathon Phillips, Clerk of Cts. Thomas J. Campion Jr., "MDJ" Christina E. Hale, PST Paul E. Hardnock, Jr., Respondents

parties: William Taylor REIL, Petitioner v. Judge Cyrus Palmer DOLBIN, DA Christine A. Holman, First ADA Maria T. Casey, ADA Jonathon Phillips, Clerk of Cts. Thomas J. Campion Jr., “MDJ” Christina E. Hale, PST Paul E. Hardnock, Jr., Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 13th day of February, 2015, Petitioner William Taylor Reil’s “Petition for Extraordinary Relief/Redress of Grievances to the Pennsylvania Supreme Court-King’s Bench Jurisdiction Pursuant to 42 Pa.C.S. Section 726” is DENIED, and Petitioner’s Emergency Application for Su-persedeas or Stay is also DENIED.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
110 A.3d 993
William Taylor REIL, Petitioner v. Judge Cyrus Palmer DOLBIN, DA Christine A. Holman, First ADA Maria T. Casey, ADA Jonathon Phillips, Clerk of Cts. Thomas J. Campion Jr., “MDJ” Christina E. Hale, PST Paul E. Hardnock, Jr., Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Feb. 13, 2015.
